raw_outputs.input: Patient with facial flushing after eating. This is carcinoid syndrome
raw_outputs.direct_response: Carcinoid syndrome is caused by the release of vasoactive substances, such as serotonin, histamine, and bradykinin, from neuroendocrine tumors (carcinoid tumors). Facial flushing is a common symptom, often triggered by certain foods, alcohol, or stress. Other symptoms can include diarrhea, wheezing, and abdominal pain. Diagnosis is typically made based on clinical symptoms and biochemical tests, such as measuring 5-hydroxyindoleacetic acid (5-HIAA) in the urine. Treatment
